results.title: Mayes C Rubeo
results.brief_description: Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to MCU, having worked on WandaVision and Thor: Ragnarok before Thor: Love and Thunder, but her costume design credentials include some of the biggest blockbusters.

constellations_primary.name: Mayes C Rubeo
constellations_primary.description: Emmy-award winning and Oscar-nominated costume designer Mayes C Rubeo has worked on some of Hollywood's biggest blockbusters, designing costumes for characters and creatures across time, space and everything in between.

results.description:
Costume designer Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). She won an Emmy for her WandaVision (2021) costume designs and previously collaborated with director Taika Waititi on Thor: Ragnarok (2017). They continued their creative partnership on Thor: Love and Thunder’s electrifying, 1980s-inspired aesthetic.

“On a project of this grand scale, it couldn’t function well if all the creative parts were not interconnected,” Rubeo said. “We had creative meetings with the director of photography, Taika, our producers, the creators, visual development, production designers, set decoration, hair and makeup. I mean, when I create a look, I create that whole, cohesive look. It has to be exactly the same DNA, and the only way to get that DNA is through communication.”
description_for_label:
Costume designer Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). She won an Emmy for her WandaVision (2021) costume designs and previously collaborated with director Taika Waititi on Thor: Ragnarok (2017). They continued their creative partnership on Thor: Love and Thunder’s electrifying, 1980s-inspired aesthetic.

“On a project of this grand scale, it couldn’t function well if all the creative parts were not interconnected,” Rubeo said. “We had creative meetings with the director of photography, Taika, our producers, the creators, visual development, production designers, set decoration, hair and makeup. I mean, when I create a look, I create that whole, cohesive look. It has to be exactly the same DNA, and the only way to get that DNA is through communication.”

results.title: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
results.brief_description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for Leaps and Bounds (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG.

constellations_primary.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_primary.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

results.title_for_label: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
results.description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for ‘Leaps and Bounds’ (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG, which is also namechecked in the song’s opening line. Directed by Mike Bell, Kelly and band were filmed playing on top of the Punt Road silos for the clip which is beloved for its time capsule quality.
description_for_label: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for ‘Leaps and Bounds’ (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG, which is also namechecked in the song’s opening line. Directed by Mike Bell, Kelly and band were filmed playing on top of the Punt Road silos for the clip which is beloved for its time capsule quality.

results.title: Hanimex Rondette 400S 35mm colour slide projector
results.brief_description: “Hanimex Rondette 400S 35mm colour slide projector Made in New Zealand f2.8 projector 8.5mm 230 - 240 V 50CYC A.C. Only 60W Use 12V 50W Iodine Quartz Lamp. Made in New Zealand by Hanimex Manufacturing Ltd. Green guarantee sticker on the bottom: N.Z. No 37229 Housed in original cardboard box. Air New Zealand MELBOURNE destination tag stapled to top of the box. Purchased from Christchurch International Duty Free Shop. 3 slides: - Man in Traditional dress. ‘Taken on Board Rasa Sayang. Handwritten label: BL 23 - Test slide for Reflector Adjustment - Kodachrome transparency of 3 men performing in a band. Standard 36 Han-O-Matic Magazine original box with index printed on outside. Kindermann (Adapter Rachmen) original red cardboard box. 37 Kindermann Adapters for 110 slides. Made in West Germany. Three plastic 110 Film slide viewers Paperwork included: Kodacolour II Film Instructions Hanimex La Rondette 400S QI Instructions Hanimex Magazine Instructions Hanimex Guarantee card”

results.title: Ice Age
results.creator_credit: Lori Forte, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Blue Sky Studios and Chris Wedge
results.brief_description: Ice Age is set 20,000 years ago, amidst the time of Neanderthals and pre-historic animals. As thousands of creatures head south, away from the ice and freezing cold, three turn north, in an unlikely quest to save a human baby.

constellations_other.name: Make it cute, make them think
constellations_other.description: Cartoons and anime are known for their dynamic and vibrant visuals, but beneath the cuteness they can also deliver powerful environmental messages and address the climate crisis.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lori Forte, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Blue Sky Studios and Chris Wedge
results.description: Ice age is set 20,000 years ago, amidst the time of Neanderthals and pre-historic animals. As thousands of creatures head south, away from the ice and freezing cold, three turn north, in an unlikely quest to save a human baby. The team consist of Manny, a depressed and kindly woolly mammoth; a sabre-toothed tiger named Diego; and Sid, a chatty sloth. Together these three battle volcanoes, predators and each other to rescue a child’s life, which ironically represents for them a future predator. With some truly wonderful set pieces, the animators of “Ice age” have created quite a magical netherworld where the dodo bird is depicted as too dim to ensure its survival into the next age and a persistent squirrel assiduously attempts to salvage a single acorn for a future feed. “Ice age” is very much family entertainment and should also prove interesting to those tracking the developments of computer animation. Humorously written, if at times a little twee, the film is a parable about friendship, acceptance and banding together. Featuring the voices of John Leguizamo, Ray Romano, Denis Leary, Jack Black and Jane Krakowski.
description_for_label: Ice age is set 20,000 years ago, amidst the time of Neanderthals and pre-historic animals. As thousands of creatures head south, away from the ice and freezing cold, three turn north, in an unlikely quest to save a human baby. The team consist of Manny, a depressed and kindly woolly mammoth; a sabre-toothed tiger named Diego; and Sid, a chatty sloth. Together these three battle volcanoes, predators and each other to rescue a child’s life, which ironically represents for them a future predator. With some truly wonderful set pieces, the animators of “Ice age” have created quite a magical netherworld where the dodo bird is depicted as too dim to ensure its survival into the next age and a persistent squirrel assiduously attempts to salvage a single acorn for a future feed. “Ice age” is very much family entertainment and should also prove interesting to those tracking the developments of computer animation. Humorously written, if at times a little twee, the film is a parable about friendship, acceptance and banding together. Featuring the voices of John Leguizamo, Ray Romano, Denis Leary, Jack Black and Jane Krakowski.

results.title: Indonesia calling
results.creator_credit: Joris Ivens, Catherine Duncan and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description: Appointed as film commissioner to the Dutch Indies, it was intended that Ivens would create educational films on behalf of the Dutch government and would document the liberation of Indonesia from Japanese occupation. When it became obvious that the Dutch government had no interest in granting independance to Indonesia, Ivens resigned. Working clandestinely, he recorded this film in support of the struggle by the Indonesian people to gain their independance. The film shows efforts by Australian dockworkers and striking Indonesian seamen to prevent the shipment of arms and ammunition to Indonesia aboard Dutch vessels. Cinematography, Marion Michelle. Editing, Joris Ivens and Jock Levy. Script, Joris Ivens and Catherine Duncan. Commentary, Peter Finch.

results.title: The Meeting place
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Catherine Duncan
results.brief_description: The town of Nuriootpa - an aboriginal word meaning “the meeting place” - lies in the rich Barossa valley in South Australia, about fifty miles from Adelaide. Although superficially Nuriootpa may appear to be much like any other Australian country town, it is in fact a place where co-operation and collective effort have won for the community many facilities which most country towns lack. Acting through a community committee consisting of representee of the residents of Nuriootpa, a hotel and a co-operative store have been established a technical school and youth centre opened, a swimming pool and a health centre built, and plans for future development drawn up.
